sentence.Network_cn: 请欢迎我们的下一位竞赛选手。

sentence.Network_en: The judges passed on each contestant.
sentence.Network_cn: 裁判员对每一位参赛者加以品评.

sentence.Network_en: The company will furnish each contestant with a free ticket.
sentence.Network_cn: 公司将为每个参赛者免费提供一张票.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French, present participle of contester, from Latin contestari 'call upon to witness' (see contest)

entry.def: A contestant in a competition or quiz is a person who takes part in it.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who participates in competitions
2. a person who dissents from some established policy

auth_sentence.content: The contestant has no information on Monty s mindset.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+test测试,试验,证据→共同测试→竞争,竞赛
pro在前面[提出]+test测试,试验,证据→提出证明→抗议,反对

stems_affixes.value_cn: 测试, 试验, 检验
stems_affixes.word_buile: test测试,试验,证据→n.&v.测试, 试验, 检验
de离开+test测试,试验,证据→不愿作证→嫌恶
test测试,试验,证据+ify表动词→v.作证,证明;[to]表明,说明
con共同+test测试,试验,证据→共同测试→竞争,竞赛

Sentence.sentence: The fifth contestant won the biggest prize
The first four contestants won only small prizes, but the fifth left with a new luxury car.
A lot of contestants participated in the show

sentences.en: Two candidates are emerging as contestants for the presidency.
sentences.cn: 两位候选人最终成为总统职位竞争者。

jushi.english: Her Olympic experience gave her a big advantage over the other contestants for the final victory.
jushi.chinese: 她的奥运会参赛经历使她比起其他竞技对手在争取最终获胜上具有很大的优势。

jushi.english: The contestants lined up for the 100-yard dash.
jushi.chinese: 参赛选手列队参加100码短跑。

jushi.english: Many of the 18 contestants were looking a little shy.
jushi.chinese: 那18位竞争者大多数看上去有点害羞。
